reviews.review: good, but i hate the new killer

Dead by Daylight is a competitive survival horror game. TL;DR if you're willing to put time into learning the mechanics and figuring out which perks/playstyle work the best for you then you will most likely enjoy this game. It does have its flaws, but no game is perfect and at the end of the day I really enjoy it and think it's definitely worth 20 dollars. 

Here are some warnings of some of the more negative things about this game that people may not like.

Like I said before this game is a competitive multiplayer game. There is no casual or anything and the ranking system is very strange. How it works is essentially after a certain amount of time everyone's rank will get lowered. However, it will stay at a level that is somewhat close to the level you were at when your rank was reset. So in a sense, this game doesn't reset you how a competitive game typically would. The thing I feel is most strange about the ranking system though is that since there are no placement matches or an unranked rank, people who take long breaks from the game end up at rank 20, which is the lowest you can go. This means that people who are coming back to the game have to unintentionally smurf for long periods of time depending on how high of a rank you were when you stopped playing. If I was a rank 3 killer, took a few months' break from the game, and came back, I would be at a rank similar to those who are just picking up the game. I think this is a little unfair for newer players, and veterans of the game aren't getting any sort of challenge from these matches, often times making the matches feel kind of boring. 

Upon getting into high rank games, you'll come to find more and more toxic people because that is where all the sweaty neckbeards end up after playing the game in their basement for 16 hours a day. This would theoretically happen in every game, but when you come up against players using the most toxic crutch perk builds, or groups of four survivors all talking to each other in Discord using perks to punish killers making the slightest error, it becomes a little annoying to say the least. Not to mention people will often times D/C from the game as survivor if they're getting annoyed, which in a game like Dead By Daylight where there are only 4 players on your team is essentially a death sentence for all of the teammates involved. People tend to be pretty nasty in this game in the high ranks, which is what essentially what made me stop playing it back in 2018. I would consistently get messages from angry survivors after I killed them saying mean things to me, which doesn't necessarily get to me, but it might get to some people. I would recommend turning your profile comments off if you're a killer main who is easily offended by people trash talking you, as that is a common thing people do on PC.

Overall though the game is good, and the toxicity isn't that bad. You'll only notice it if you get into the extremely high ranks. Check it out if you like horror games, as this game is pretty fun, especially with friends.

Es un juego adictivo, lo cual por sÃ­ mismo no justifica su compra. Al inicio (primeras 30-40 horas de juego) es muy estimulante en emociones como el miedo, sorpresa, expectaciÃ³n e, inherentemente, en la felicidad por haber ganado luego de sufrir lo anterior. A largo plazo se vuelve tan repetitivo como cualquier otro juego, lo Ãºnico novedoso serÃ¡n los jugadores y estrategias que lleves a cabo gracias a la experiencia adquirida.

No es free to win, pero sin pagar nunca podrÃ¡s acceder a todo el contenido (cosmeticos, habilidades y personajes). 5 aÃ±os luego de su lanzamiento, continÃºa teniendo actualizaciones y jugadores esperando escapar del Ente.

It used to be a fun game when i was able to connect to lobbies. Now Can't even play a single game, every time that i find a game ,after a long loading, i get the error "disconnected from host". And it happens for both Survivor and Killer. I've tried plenty of different DNS and none of them have worked so far. It has been like this for couple of months now.
And I was really looking forward to the Resident Evil Chapter and hoped that the mentioned issue would get fixed.
Update: Finally found a fix here : https://steamcommunity.com/app/381210/discussions/0/3007801544742220143/?ctp=2

Dead by Daylight has had a somewhat rocky history filled with bugs, toxicity, and developers that are at times tone deaf and out of touch with their game's playerbase. At the same time though, Dead by Daylight is the undisputed king of the asymmetrical horror genre ever since the Friday the 13th devs bailed, and its flaws are overstated.

Though a lot of content at this point in the game's 5 year lifespan requires payment or intense amounts of in-game grinding, DbD has a massive library of famous franchises including Halloween, Nightmare on Elm Street, Silent Hill, and now Resident Evil that has grown significantly since launch. What this means is that yes, a lot of content will be pay/grind locked, but not because of the developer's greed. The older DLCs often go on sale for significant discounts, so if you pick and choose the ones you want you won't be spending that much money. (FYI: licensed content like the Resident Evil characters cannot be grinded, and must be bought with real money. Original content is fair game however.)

Both Killers and Survivors can be fun to play solo, although the survivor experience is without a doubt heavily enhanced by playing with friends. In my opinion, the game's toxicity, at least currently, is massively overstated, especially due to the fact that since we now have crossplay, communicating in the endgame chat is often impossible, so the harassment and slurs that used to populate the chat have nearly vanished (not like that was the only type of discussion to happen there in the first place). You will still find the occasional player in game that teabags and mocks you, but few multiplayer games don't have experiences like that. Don't be surprised if you meet the occasional smurf either. 

All in all, at this price point DbD at least warrants a try if you think the gameplay looks at least somewhat appealing to you; don't be discouraged by the reviews that claim this game has atrocious balancing and terrible developers, since while there are certainly some issues in both departments, DbD can still be quite fun and competitive to boot.
